print("%html

Working with PXF and External Data

") print("

HAWQ Extension Framework (PXF) is an extensible framework that allows HAWQ to query external system data. PXF includes built-in connectors for accessing data inside HDFS files, Hive tables, and HBase tables. PXF also integrates with HCatalog to query Hive tables directly.

") print("
")

result.msg:
Working with PXF and External Data

HAWQ Extension Framework (PXF) is an extensible framework that allows HAWQ to query external system data. PXF includes built-in connectors for accessing data inside HDFS files, Hive tables, and HBase tables. PXF also integrates with HCatalog to query Hive tables directly.

paragraphs.text:

Using PXF to Query CSV and JSON

") print("

result.msg: Using PXF to Query CSV and JSON

paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

DROP SCHEMA IF EXISTS text CASCADE;
CREATE SCHEMA text;
DROP EXTERNAL TABLE IF EXISTS  text.customer;
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE text.customer 
    ( c_customer_sk             bigint              
  , c_customer_id             text              
  , c_current_cbigbench_sk        bigint
  , c_current_hbigbench_sk        bigint
  , c_current_addr_sk         bigint
  , c_first_shipto_date_sk    bigint
  , c_first_sales_date_sk     bigint
  , c_salutation              text
  , c_first_name              text
  , c_last_name               text
  , c_preferred_cust_flag     text
  , c_birth_day               int
  , c_birth_month             int
  , c_birth_year              int
  , c_birth_country           text
  , c_login                   text
  , c_email_address           text
  , c_last_review_date        text
)
LOCATION ('pxf://sandbox:51200 /hawq-sandbox-demos/customer?Profile=HdfsTextSimple') FORMAT 'CSV' (DELIMITER='|');

%file

ls /hawq-sandbox-demos/customer

%psql.sql

select * from text.customer limit 8;

Using PXF and HBase

HBase tables can be queried directly through HAWQ and PXF
NOTE: HBASE is not installed in this Sandbox by Default,
so this section will not run initially

paragraphs.text:
%hbase

list

%hbase

describe 'customer'

%hbase

get 'customer', '10005'

%psql.sql
DROP SCHEMA IF EXISTS hbase CASCADE;
CREATE SCHEMA hbase;
DROP EXTERNAL TABLE IF EXISTS hbase.customer;
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE hbase.customer
  ( 
   -- c_customer_sk              bigint    
    recordkey 					 integer
  , "cf1:c_customer_id"          text              
  , "cf1:c_current_cbigbench_sk" bigint
  , "cf1:c_current_hbigbench_sk" bigint
  , "cf1:c_current_addr_sk"      bigint
  , "cf1:c_first_shipto_date_sk" bigint
  , "cf1:c_first_sales_date_sk"  bigint
  , "cf1:c_salutation"           text
  , "cf1:c_first_name"           text
  , "cf1:c_last_name"			 text
  , "cf1:c_preferred_cust_flag"  text
  , "cf1:c_birth_day"            int
  , "cf1:c_birth_month"          int
  , "cf1:c_birth_year"           int
  , "cf1:c_birth_country"        text
  , "cf1:c_login"                text
  , "cf1:c_email_address"        text
  , "cf1:c_last_review_date"     text
)
LOCATION ('pxf://sandbox:51200/customer?Profile=HBase')
FORMAT 'CUSTOM' (formatter='pxfwritable_import');

DROP  EXTERNAL TABLE IF EXISTS hbase.customer_demographics;
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE hbase.customer_demographics
  ( 
     recordkey                      bigint               
  , "cf1:cd_gender"                 text
  , "cf1:cd_marital_status"         text
  , "cf1:cd_education_status"       text
  , "cf1:cd_purchase_estimate"      text
  , "cf1:cd_credit_rating"          text
  , "cf1:cd_dep_count"              text
  , "cf1:cd_dep_employed_count"     text
  , "cf1:cd_dep_college_count"      text
  )
LOCATION ('pxf://sandbox:51200/customer_demographics?Profile=HBase')FORMAT 'CUSTOM' (formatter='pxfwritable_import');

%psql.sql
select * from hbase.customer limit 10;

%psql.sql

select * from hbase.customer where recordkey=10005;

paragraphs.title: List of the Top 5 products most frequently sold together (BEER and DIAPERS Problem)
paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

SELECT sub1.ss_item_sk as item_sk_1, sub2.ss_item_sk as item_sk_2, COUNT(*) AS cnt
 FROM
(
SELECT ss_ticket_number, ss_item_sk
FROM hawq.store_sales s, hawq.item i
WHERE s.ss_item_sk = i.i_item_sk
AND i.i_category_id in (1,2,3)
AND s.ss_store_sk IN (10, 20, 33, 40, 50)
GROUP BY ss_ticket_number, ss_item_sk
) as sub1
join 
(
SELECT ss_ticket_number, ss_item_sk
FROM hawq.store_sales s, hawq.item i
WHERE s.ss_item_sk = i.i_item_sk
AND i.i_category_id in (1,2,3)
AND s.ss_store_sk IN (10, 20, 33, 40, 50)
GROUP BY ss_ticket_number, ss_item_sk
) as sub2 on sub1.ss_ticket_number = sub2.ss_ticket_number and sub1.ss_item_sk <> sub2.ss_item_sk
GROUP BY sub1.ss_item_sk, sub2.ss_item_sk
HAVING count(*) > 50
ORDER BY 3 DESC, 1, 2
LIMIT 5;

paragraphs.title: Linear Regression to predict interest in categories based on clickstream info and customer demographics.
Prepare Data
paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS hawq.web_clicks;
CREATE TABLE hawq.web_clicks (
 --wcs_user_sk BIGINT,-- column is used to identify prediction
 clicks_in_category BIGINT, --column is used as label, all following columns are used as input vector to the ml algorithm
 college_education  BIGINT,
 male               BIGINT,
 clicks_in_1        BIGINT,
 clicks_in_2        BIGINT,
 clicks_in_3        BIGINT,
 clicks_in_4        BIGINT,
 clicks_in_5        BIGINT,
 clicks_in_6        BIGINT,
 clicks_in_7        BIGINT
)with (appendonly=true, orientation=parquet,compresstype=snappy)
DISTRIBUTED RANDOMLY;



INSERT INTO  hawq.web_clicks (
SELECT
  --wcs_user_sk,
  clicks_in_category,
  CASE WHEN cd_education_status like 'Advanced Degree' OR 
  	        cd_education_status like 'College' OR  
			cd_education_status like '4 yr Degree' OR 
			cd_education_status like '2 yr Degree' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS college_education,
  CASE WHEN cd_gender = 'M' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS male,
  clicks_in_1,
  clicks_in_2,
  clicks_in_3,
  clicks_in_4,
  clicks_in_5,
  clicks_in_6,
  clicks_in_7
FROM( 
  SELECT 
    wcs_user_sk,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category = 'Books' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_category,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category_id = 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_1,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category_id = 2 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_2,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category_id = 3 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_3,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category_id = 4 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_4,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category_id = 5 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_5,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category_id = 6 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_6,
    SUM( CASE WHEN i_category_id = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS clicks_in_7
  FROM hawq.web_clickstreams
  INNER JOIN hawq.item it ON (wcs_item_sk = i_item_sk
                     AND wcs_user_sk IS NOT NULL)
  GROUP BY  wcs_user_sk
)q05_user_clicks_in_cat
INNER JOIN hawq.customer ct ON wcs_user_sk = c_customer_sk
INNER JOIN hawq.customer_demographics ON c_current_cdemo_sk = cd_demo_sk)
;

%psql.sql

select * from web_clicks;

paragraphs.title: Train Model
Predict Using the Model
Use K-Means Cluster to classify customers into segments of Reading Interests.
Prepare Data
paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql 

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS book_group_data;
CREATE TABLE book_group_data (
  cid  BIGINT,
  id1  float,
  id2  float,
  id3  float,
  id4  float,
  id5  float,
  id6  float,
  id7  float,
  id8  float,
  id9  float,
  id10 float,
  id11 float,
  id12 float,
  id13 float,
  id14 float,
  id15 float
);

INSERT INTO  book_group_data (
SELECT
  ss.ss_customer_sk AS cid,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=1  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id1,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=2  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id2,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=3  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id3,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=4  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id4,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=5  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id5,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=6  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id6,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=7  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id7,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=8  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id8,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=9  THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id9,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=10 THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id10,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=11 THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id11,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=12 THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id12,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=13 THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id13,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=14 THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id14,
  count(CASE WHEN i.i_class_id=15 THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) AS id15
FROM hawq.store_sales ss
INNER JOIN hawq.item i 
  ON (ss.ss_item_sk = i.i_item_sk
  AND i.i_category like 'Books'
  AND ss.ss_customer_sk IS NOT NULL
)
GROUP BY ss.ss_customer_sk
HAVING count(ss.ss_item_sk) > 5
--CLUSTER BY cid --cluster by preceded by group by is silently ignored by hive but fails in spark
ORDER BY cid)
;

drop view if exists book_group_params;
CREATE VIEW book_group_params AS (SELECT *,ARRAY[id1,id2,id3,id4,id5,id6,id7,id8,id9,id10,id11,id12,id13,id14,id15] as features FROM book_group_data);

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION unnest_2d_1d(anyarray)
  RETURNS SETOF anyarray AS
$func$
SELECT array_agg($1[d1][d2])
FROM   generate_series(array_lower($1,1), array_upper($1,1)) d1
     , generate_series(array_lower($1,2), array_upper($1,2)) d2
GROUP  BY d1
ORDER  BY d1
$func$
LANGUAGE SQL IMMUTABLE;

paragraphs.title: Generate Cluster Series Information
paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

drop table if exists book_group_result;
CREATE TABLE book_group_result AS 
SELECT generate_series(array_lower(centroids,1), array_upper(centroids, 1)) as c, unnest_2d_1d(centroids) as centroids
FROM  (select * from  madlib.kmeans_random('book_group_params',
               'features',
               5,
                'madlib.dist_norm2',
                              'madlib.avg', 
                              100, 0
            )) q1;

%psql.sql
select * from book_group_result;

paragraphs.title: Classify Users with the K-Means Algorithm
paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

drop table if exists book_group_classification;
CREATE TABLE book_group_classification AS 
SELECT data.*, (madlib.closest_column(centroids, features)).column_id as cluster_id
FROM book_group_params as data,
     (SELECT centroids
      FROM  madlib.kmeans_random('book_group_params',
               'features',
               5,
                'madlib.dist_norm2',
                              'madlib.avg', 
                              100, 0
            )) as q1;

%psql.sql

select * from  book_group_classification;
